docs.lead_paragraph: The Red Sox gave Manager Bobby Valentine a two-year contract, a short-term commitment that stamped him with a win-or-else directive — and a flawed roster.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that the Boston Red Sox hired manager Bobby Valentine to win games, but saddled him with a flawed roster without the tools to do so.
docs.snippet: The Red Sox gave Manager Bobby Valentine a two-year contract, a short-term commitment that stamped him with a win-or-else directive — and a flawed roster....

headline.seo: Boston’s Bobby Valentine, With Flawed Roster, Is Left to Fight for His Job
headline.main: Valentine, Hired to Win, Is Missing Tools to Do So
headline.print_headline: Valentine, Hired to Win, Is Missing Tools to Do So

docs.lead_paragraph: After blowing a nine-run lead and losing to the Yankees on Saturday, Bobby Valentine’s Red Sox are 4-10, staggering at almost the exact pace they did to finish last season.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox are 4-10, staggering at almost the exact pace they did to finish last season.
docs.snippet: After blowing a nine-run lead and losing to the Yankees on Saturday, Bobby Valentine’s Red Sox are 4-10, staggering at almost the exact pace they did to finish last season....

headline.seo: For Boston Red Sox, ‘Things Just Kind of Snowballed’
headline.main: In Game as in the Season, ‘Things Kind of Snowballed’
headline.print_headline: In Game as in the Season, ‘Things Kind of Snowballed’

docs.lead_paragraph: Bobby Valentine, the Red Sox’ new manager, professes optimism as spring training opens for a team that finished 7-20 and blew a playoff spot.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that Bobby Valentine, the Boston Red Sox new manager, professes optimism as spring training opens for a team that finished 7-20 last season and blew a playoff.
docs.snippet: Bobby Valentine, the Red Sox’ new manager, professes optimism as spring training opens for a team that finished 7-20 and blew a playoff spot....

headline.seo: Valentine Welcomes First Spring Managing Red Sox
headline.main: To Valentine, Boston’s Dark Winter Is Over
headline.print_headline: To Valentine, Boston’s Dark Winter Is Over

docs.lead_paragraph: Nobody knows if Bobby Valentine, the new manager of the Boston Red Sox, will guide his team out of its third-place malaise. We might not know until the very end of the regular season. But the journey to get there will be fascinating.
docs.abstract: Bobby Valentine is set to take over the Red Sox -- and make a big impression on their rabid fans.
docs.snippet: Bobby Valentine is set to take over the Red Sox -- and make a big impression on their rabid fans....

headline.main: For Red Sox, Life Just Got Very Interesting

docs.lead_paragraph: Boston, which went 7-20 in the final month of the season, said that the cost of all tickets available to the public will be unchanged.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; Boston Red Sox will keep ticket prices the same for the 2012 season following their historic September collapse and revelations about players drinking beer and eating chicken while games were being played; other MLB news noted.
docs.snippet: Boston, which went 7-20 in the final month of the season, said that the cost of all tickets available to the public will be unchanged....

headline.seo: Red Sox Keep Ticket Prices the Same After September Collapse
headline.main: Red Sox Keep Ticket Prices the Same After September Collapse
headline.print_headline: Red Sox Keep Ticket Prices Same After September Collapse

docs.lead_paragraph: After beating the Texas Rangers on Sept. 3, the Boston Red Sox were 84-54. Although half a game behind the Yankees in the American League East, the Red Sox had a nine-game lead over the Tampa Bay Rays for the wild card and roughly a 99.6 percent chance of making the playoffs.
docs.abstract: If the Red Sox fail to win their final two games, their late-season swoon could be historic.
docs.snippet: If the Red Sox fail to win their final two games, their late-season swoon could be historic....

headline.main: September Collapse of Red Sox Could Be Worst Ever

docs.lead_paragraph: A franchise that once waited 86 years for a championship is antsy for another, with good reason.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes the sense of relief at Fenway Park as Boston Red Sox beat arch-rival New York Yankees for their first win of the season; notes that Red Sox great Carl Ystrzemski threw out first pitch.
docs.snippet: A franchise that once waited 86 years for a championship is antsy for another, with good reason....
